meta.content: Lonedell R-XIV - Letter from Dr. Dierker

Dear Lonedell R-14 Parents/Guardians,
I am writing you to provide some guidance with student learning and ways to stay in contact during the closure of the Lonedell R-14 School District.
As you are aware, we will be closed through April 3 rd due to safety measures to protect against COVID-19. At that time, district administration...

input.name: artSection
input.value: CLOSURE|Student Learning Information>>Letter from Dr. Dierker

span.span: I am writing you to provide some guidance with student learning and ways to stay in contact during the closure of the Lonedell R-14 School District.
As you are aware, we will be closed

due to safety measures to protect against COVID-19. At that time, district administration will reevaluate and communicate any further information. This situation really is undesirable, but it is important for the safety and protection of all individuals, especially our most vulnerable and high-risk populations. The teachers at Lonedell have worked hard to build
for students to complete at home.
Parents/Guardians, our goal is to keep kids learning, get them thinking, have them move, and to ensure they have some creative outlets as they will spend a lot of time at home.
This is to serve as a resource for you and the students and not meant to be an extra burden.
While this is not the preferred method of instruction
because we have minimal families with home internet, this is the next best-case scenario. We have built 10 days worth of instruction
as a resource for students to work on through the closure
Within the instructional packets, you will find instruction in core areas and activity classes. Some involve some worksheets, review, creative projects, hands on task
The hope is that you can use this to keep kids busy and their minds active during the closure.
to familiarize yourself and your kid(s).
I know many of you have jobs, so use your best capabilities to keep them moving through materials, projects, and assignment
s. We are aware that there could be some limitations.
This is far from ideal, but hopefully will keep kids engaged in the richest content possible. Once we return to school, students will bring the
and turn them into the teachers.
Will teachers and staff be available to contact during the closure?
The staff will be accessible during this time of closure to answer questions and support the kids. If you need any questions answered
in regards to the learning packets
, feel free to email our teachers
hey will answer your questions within a reasonable time period. Here are emails for our teachers…

span.span: *You can find other staff members emails by going to
, clicking in the menu tab in the top left corner of the browser, and then clicking on staff directory on the bottom of the list.
Are there other methods, besides email, where I can get in contact with my child’s teacher?

Teachers are also being asked to create an easy method for you to be able to communicate. Some classroom teachers already have a platform that they use to communicate like Remind or Class Dojo. If they do not, they will be creating one in the next few days and send an invite out to your cell phone. It would be up to you to then set it up, but our goal is to make instructional staff as available as possible. My ultimate dream w
be for staff to be able to video chat to teach class, but with limited internet capabilities in our
Can I access the learning materials online?
While we are sending the instructional materials home to students, you can also
if you do not get a copy or need an extra copy. To access all the materials, please go to our website at
, click the menu tab on the top left of the webpage, click on the link that says Closure
, then click on the link that says
. In this location, you will also find free online resources where you can have students engaged in instructional materials online for additional student enrichment.
This situation is far from ideal, but it is the necessary for the safety of all individuals. It will be sad not to see kids in the hallways
in the classrooms engaged in learning, laughter, and fun. While we are out, please encourage your child to remain positive, as this all will pass

. Use this time to make some memories, engage in family board games, puzzles, outdoor fun, cooking, movie nights, and lots of great activities at home. Motivate them to stay up on these academics that teachers have created to keep kids engaged in active learning.

We will work hard to stay connected to each of you! Please make sure and like our Facebook page, where we will remain active through this closure. You can find us by searching the Lonedell R-14 School District. You can also follow us on Twitter at @r14bobcats.
I am thinking of each of you during this challenging time and I hope you can stay as stress free as possible and are not placed with too many financial burdens.
